title: public servant to whom this Order applies shall stand at the amount at which it
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act 

2017 (Section 20(4)) Order 2022.
text_norm: 1 order may cited public service pay pension act 2017 (section 20(4)) order 2022

title: public servant to whom this Order applies shall stand at the amount at which it
heading: 2. This Order applies to a public servant to whom section 20 of the Public
text_raw:
2. This Order applies to a public servant to whom section 20 of the Public 

Service Pay and Pensions Act 2017 (No. 34 of 2017) applies.
text_norm: 2 order applies public servant section 20 public service pay pension act 2017 (no 34 2017) applies

title: public servant to whom this Order applies shall stand at the amount at which it
heading: 3. On and from 1 July 2022, the annualised amount of the basic salary of a
text_raw:
3. On and from 1 July 2022, the annualised amount of the basic salary of a 
public servant to whom this Order applies shall stand at the amount at which it 
stood immediately before the enactment of section 2 of the Financial 
Emergency Measures in the Public Interest (No. 2) Act 2009 (No. 41 of 2009). 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 1st July, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [316] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

28 June, 2022. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [316]
